cards.back: Roots of denominator. Where H(s)→∞. Determine stability and transient behavior.
Roots of numerator. Where H(s)=0. Shape frequency response, block certain frequencies.
Stable (decaying exponential). Real part < 0 gives e^(σt) with σ<0.
Unstable! Growing exponential. Real part > 0 gives unbounded response.
Marginally stable. Sustained oscillation. Neither growing nor decaying.
Rightmost pole (closest to jω-axis). Slowest decaying mode. Dominates long-term response.
Oscillatory response. Real part = decay rate. Imaginary part = oscillation frequency.

cards.front: Damping ratio ζ from poles at -σ±jω
cards.back:
ζ = σ/√(σ²+ω²) = cos(θ)
θ = angle from negative real axis.
